intro: Christopteris tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like leaves that are typically three-lobed, giving it its scientific name. This species thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky crevices or on decaying wood. The plant reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its leaves. Christopteris tricuspis plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing microhabitats for various small organisms.
